programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Lemon and Raspberry make the final preparations for the contest. Strawberry offers the twins to be models at the contest instead of her. Sweet is delighted, but Sour is not excited. Shortly before the show is broadcast, Sour sabotages the TV equipment.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is reluctant to have a bath so he goes to Dino-World where he endeavours to become as dirty and stinky as he possibly can.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harrys friend Charlie brings her new kitten (Buster) to visit Harry.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo spots a South African cheetah cub in his garden. The Junior Rangers journey to the savannah to locate the cheetah cub’s mother, but the cheetah cub is captured halfway by illegal hunters. Will the Junior Rangers have enough speed to catch up with these criminals?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas is working in Brazil when he hears exciting music hes never heard before - batucada! Thomas is pulling cars/trucks that make great percussion sounds when he rolls along. So, when Thomas meets a batucada band, he is invited to start the carnival with his noisy trucks that biff and bash along to the beat. Later on, when hes dropped off the cars/trucks, Thomas is worried that he wont be able to join in with the batucada band. But then something helps him remember how he can take part!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Diesel resents being scolded when he makes a mistake, and takes advantage of Rebeccas good nature.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Maria ordered way too much stock and if she doesnt sell hundreds of pizzas today, everything will be ruined! Grisu offers to do some advertising to bring people in. After a shooting session, Grisu Stella and Fume distribute and stick flyers and posters around the city. But Fume overzealous sticks his posters anywhere. Grisu has to catch up with his fathers mistakes and ends up burning the cart full of flyers. After his despair moment, Grisu has the idea to do an air show. With his father, they draw a giant pizza in the sky, made with colored smoke...and it works.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Stella is taking part in a dance video contest and she asks Grisu to dance along with her. The young dragon accepts immediately. But as soon as they start filming, Fume comes in and asks his son to do dragon training with him. He then unwittingly makes Grisu fall and botches the shot. From then on, Stella and Grisu keep changing location so that they can shoot in a "quiet" place, meaning without Fume. But the older dragon shows up anyway and ruins the shot, albeit unvoluntarily.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One morning in the early Springtime, Little Nutbrown Hare wakes to find the air filled with a delightful smell. He and Little Field Mouse search all over the meadow, the woods and by the riverside to find the source of the wonderful smell. They discover all kinds of new and unexpected Spring scents… sweet, pretty and fresh, but will they find the one they are searching for?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare watches as Blue Bird’s eggs hatch into three happy, chirpy baby birds. Fascinated and charmed by these youngsters, he visits them every day and even helps teach them to sing, play and fly. But how will he feel when Summer is on its way and they are ready to fly the nest and make homes of their own?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: So that his snack and game party is a success, Scoutbadger starts to do all the things that had been allotted to the others. He says he does things better and faster - even if it is not true. The others decide to let him get on with it. When he realises that he has forgotten his own task, that of inviting their friends, Scoutbadger realizes that he has gone too far.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mayor Madison has arranged for Ballroom Blitz, TV dance sensation, to come on tour to Spring City. When star dancer, Sylvain de Souza, threatens to cancel the show unless he gets a sprung dance floor, Maria enlists Bob to save the day, in return for a show tango with her hero. Dance fever sweeps Team Bob and the Spring City Rockets but Lofty despairs of ever being able to dance as well as the others. Just as he finds his dancing mojo, Lofty accidentally wrecks part of the sprung dance floor. Sylvain recognizes a kindred spirit in Lofty and urges him to follow his dreams, no matter how unlikely they may seem.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Mila is appearing on the children’s TV game show, “Whiz-A-Quiz”, the rest of the Spring City Rockets are disappointed that they didn’t get tickets to watch and support her. This gives Mayor Madison the idea for Bob to build an outdoor movie area at the Stadium where everyone can watch the game show together. But when Mayor Madison asks Lofty to help the Spring City Rockets decorate the stadium, he gets carried away and leaves Leo to finish the support frames for the giant screen all by himself. A job that is too big for one person. When the giant screen arrives, the frame isn’t sturdy enough to hold it and the whole structure starts falling apart. Lofty races in and saves the TV screen but the frame, stage and audience seating are broken.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Mr Frumble’s morning newspaper disappears off his front step, Huckle sets out to investigate what happened to it. After a number of other innocuous items ‘disappear’ from across town, Huckle ultimately discovers that the culprits are none other than Pig Will and Pig Won’t. They are enthusiastically taking part in Busytown’s Annual Recycling Drive by picking up anything they see that can be recycled./Huckle, Lowly and Sally happen upon a huge tooth and can’t imagine anyone in all of Busytown big enough to own it.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers bring a young Rothschild’s giraffe to the savannah to find it a good home. However, the expedition comes to a standstill when the Junior Rangers’ jeep gets bogged in mud.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers travel to the rainforest to reunite a Malayan tiger cub with its mother. But when the cub goes missing in some tall grass, the Junior Rangers have to put their heads together to find it.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon has found an old guitar in the attic. Eva, his mother, offers to give him lessons but Simon would rather go show off to his friends, Ferdinand and Lou, who are playing in the yard. The three friends decide to form a band. But they understand pretty quickly that musically speaking, they stink! Simon goes to find his mother and asks her for some musical advice. And it works. He returns to his friends and now it’s his turn to give them advice. And they’re off and playing! What a talented band!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest gather on the hilltop to watch the evening meteor shower. Stanley and Balthazar want to build a seesaw but constantly encounter obstacles. The Firefly helps them, and with the assistance of the Moon, they swing on the Moon rocker seesaw. The meteor shower mesmerizes them, then they bid farewell to each other, and everyone starts heading home. The Firefly falls asleep contentedly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On Reggie Squirrel’s seventh birthday, he couldnt find his friends at home. He runs into Harry Hedgehog, who offers to take him for a ride in a carriage. When they return, the forest inhabitants celebrate Reggie Squirrel together, giving him seven candles as a gift. They then fly in a hot air balloon, marveling at the night sky. Finally, Reggie Squirrel happily returns home and wishes his friends a good night.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble and Stanley gather chestnuts, and then they create marvelous figures out of them at the house of the stag beetle. Bubble takes the figures home, but upon seeing the mess, Stanley offers his help. In the process, they get caught up in a series of accidents, resulting in the gingerbread house breaking. Bubble receives a new gingerbread house from Rosita the rose beetle and happily tidies up his room.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The green Grub wants to stay with Dolly for the winter, but always finds her at the wrong time with the request. The Wind accidentally blows the The Green Grub to the seaside, then brings it back to Dolly. Finally, Dolly happily welcomes the Green Grub for the winter and prepares a comfortable bed for him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 05 Mepe
programme.desc: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They have many adventures, while they make new friends and get knowledge about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest hold a baking contest to celebrate the arrival of summer, but Dr Owl goes overboard with tasting. With the help of Beetle Bodobács, they manage to save the evening with chimney cakes and dancing. The next day, Dr Owl apologizes and improves his mood with a group workout.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a rainy day, Dollys house gets flooded. When the rain stops, Stanley, the stag beetle, repairs the roof. Berry also helps Dolly, who is upset about her soaked drawings. Berry visits Raymond, the copper beetle, who has plenty of bells. He asks for two special bells to cheer Dolly up. At home, he makes coconut balls and later delivers them to Dolly along with the bells, which make her very happy. Later, Berry paints over the stain caused by the rain, and Dolly repaints the pictures with the help of Flutter and Leapy. The bells bring joy to the house.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends play Nature Explorers in Ammas garden by spinning a giant colour wheel and then finding something of that colour in the garden.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has enough money to buy one thing in Padgets shop but he finds it hard to choose between all the lovely things. After much deliberation Bing chooses a campervan but on the way home he begins to regret his decision.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its bedtime but wheres Hoppity? Bing remembers playing with him in the garden so Flop finds a torch and together they set off in the dark for an adventure.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If you get stuck, you need some help and then you can get down by yourself.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Ruperts sensitive hedgehog nose tells him that the weather tomorrow is going to be fantastic. He at once informs Tilda and the two friends decide to prepare a picnic. The other friends join in and the preparations last long into the night, with Molly and Rupert finally falling asleep in Tildas living room. .

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: In Tildas garden, Robin and another robin are quarrelling over an earthworm. Tilda wants to save the poor worm and distracts the birds by suggesting a competition. First, the robins should compete at cherry stone-spitting. This ends in a draw and Tilda sets the next task: pecking out a pattern in a leaf. Both birds peck out a star, so its a another tie.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: One chilly, windy day, Tilda wants to visit her friend Molly. On her way across the fields, she meets Patrick the sheep, whos got a cold. Tilda immediately informs Molly and together the two mice knit Patrick a nice warm scarf. Patrick is overjoyed, but now all the other sheep want scarves too. Now Tilda and Molly have to call her friends in to help.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Big Nutbrown Hare has a lot to do today. Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse promise to help but there are so many wonderful distractions they forget their promise and let Big Nutbrown Hare down. Luckily they learn a valuable lesson from some bees and get busy to make to things right!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Its Little Field Mouses birthday and Little Nutbrown Hare wants to give her exactly the right gift. After a moment’s thought he realises he has no idea what to give her. Big Nutbrown Hare encourages his son to think about everything he knows about his friend. He remembers she likes to look nice on her birthday, so her makes her a lovely necklace and she is delighted!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare keeps winning a game with Little Field Mouse, and enjoys it so much he doesnt realise she is frustrated with losing. Big Nutbrown Hare helps him realise that winning is less important than making sure everyone enjoys playing the game. So Little Nutbrown Hare invents a new game that Little Field Mouse and her twin siblings can enjoy playing too.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Hoot and Toot must make deliveries through the night, finishing before sunrise. Away from Chuggington, when Hoot’s light fails, he screeches to a halt and is too scared to move! But with some gentle encouragement and clever shadow play from Toot, Hoot realises how much fun the night time can be. All their jobs get done before sunrise, and the twins win their badges

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: On a beach in Indonesia, Zari finds tide pools littered with rubbish and a stranded bamboo shark in one of the tide pools. In the Garden, Leo is engrossed in a cricket hunt but finds the cricket on top of a slide which Hero tries to climb up. They get a call from Zari as she tells them about the shark and its inability to climb up the tide pool wall. As they arrive, Leo attempts to scoop the shark out, but the shark ends up slipping away. Katie recalls that bamboo sharks can crawl on their fins. The team fills the tide pool to facilitate the sharks escape, only to encounter another hurdle—rubbish-filled tide pools blocking its way to the sea. Ranger Rocky intervenes, and calls Ranger Joey who shares insights into the bamboo sharks ability to survive out of the water for long periods of time. The team cleans the tide pools, ensuring a safe passage for the bamboo shark back to the sea. Back at the treehouse, Leo hangs a picture of the bamboo shark as Hero slides down the slide with the cricket on his head.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah discovers a mysterious jar containing a sparkly squid while cleaning her dirt bike at a Singaporean beach. Meanwhile, in the Hero Garden, Katie initiates a complex treasure hunt for Leo that ends with an unexpected twist—a new map inside a treasure chest. The rangers receive an emergency call from Farah, who finds the squid changing colors inside the jar. Concerned for the squids well-being, they consult the computer, and identifies the squid as a Bigfin Reef Squid. The team rushes to the beach, where Leo accidentally throws the jar into the ocean in an attempt to open it. They try to grab the jar into the ocean but to no avail when suddenly Ranger Rocky grabs it from underwater! They retrieve the jar but find the squid in a seemingly lifeless state. Ranger Joeys insights reveal that the squid is likely in shock and needs a dark, cool environment to recover. The rangers transport the squid to the ocean floor near a coral reef, witnessing its vibrant transformation and ensuring it finds a safe home. Back in the Treehouse, Leo hangs a photo of the Bigfin Reef Squid, and in the Garden, Katie gets frustrated as all the treasure chests she finds only have been full of maps.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: The parents are hoping Fanni will take her afternoon nap, but she’s still wide awake, playing with her animal sounds toy… Until it stops working… Oh dear! T’choupi quickly steps in and improvises animal sounds. But when he quickly loses interest, Mom comes up with an idea: they should go and find the nearby animals and listen to their cries, straight from the "horse’s" mouth! With a bit of luck, this pleasant expedition will tire Fanni out enough to send her to sleep…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Picorette the hen has taken over the kids’ swing, using it as a perch. So T’choupi and Nina decide to build her a swing of her own. But getting Picorette to agree to change perches is another matter… Luckily, they’re able to coax her, with food!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi leaves the gate to the goats pen unlatched, one of the baby goats goes missing! Finding out about it, he’s anxious it might get into difficulties while out on its own. Benedicte suggests they follow its trail of droppings to track it down. And so off they go on a "goat dung treasure hunt" through the forest!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: This morning, the teacher receives a mysterious envelope in which she finds… the picture of a different class! And the children really panic when they overhear the director telling Daisy « the teacher is finally gone ». Could their teacher really be leaving them for another class?!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: In the courtyard, Sam and Julia have discovered that snowflakes are formed by beautiful little stars. But how can they preserve these wonders and show them to Julias mom before it melt?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have adopted a pumpkin theyve nicknamed Leo. But Sams dad is planning to make with it a delicious soup for the whole building. The two friends try anything they can to save him.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Which child will get the big spoon for the annual fondue held in memory of the very first residents of th Mouse Mansion. Sam and Julia are in competition, will their friendship hold up?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas is asked to help at the animal park for the day and realises theres more to the job than he first thought.

programme.desc: Rosies hair is getting long. It keeps getting caught inthings, until it gets tangled in play-dough. Mommy says its time for acut. programme.desc: The kids try to find the owner of a camera using the photos for clues. All the pictures are sporting events, so they eventually find out the camera belongs to the sports reporter for the Busytown Bugle./ A list Sally made mysteriously disappears right off the page.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do

programme.title: Fireman Sam

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Hannah shows off a homemade kite, her stunts cause a barbequing accident, sparking multiple fires!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Berry is annoyed with Edmund as he does not want to play at skittles with her. She decides to change fathers. Accompanied by Rosie, she wants to find out what her friends’ fathers are like.

programme.desc: What costume Sketchy really wants to wear? Doodleboo explains how to draw a Super Hero.

programme.title: Doodleboo

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave help Hatty find his matching green ice skate. Understanding that a pair is two things that look the same and go together, they have fun matching pairs by shape, size and colour. They eventually find Hatty’s missing skate at the ice rink next to two a pair of identical snowmen. And there’s still time to look for two pairs of hockey sticks and team up in pairs to enjoy a game of ice hockey!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave

Tweet directs the action, Ruff-Ruff plays Farmer Fred and Dave stars as Hilda the Cow. Despite some mishaps the show is a triumph and Hilda is inspired to throw a real party!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare finds a very special feather with bright colours, spots and soft tickly bits. Just as he shows off to his friends how it can fly and float, a cheeky bird flies away with it. Little Grey Squirrel climbs her tree and discovers the bird using it to feather her nest. Will Little Nutbrown Hare find a way to get his feather back, or will he decide that the bird needs it more than he does?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Spring morning a cute spotty ladybird lands on Little Nutbrown Hare and seems to want to stay with him. programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

programme.desc: Sula, Pando, Flop and Padget all have a knack, something special they can all do and Bing gets frustrated when his own knacks are easy for everyone else to do.

programme.desc: Sula and Bing tag all their favourite things around the house with stickers, but when Sula tags Hoppity Voosh Bing is upset because he doesnt want to share.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants Flop to read him a story when he has his bath but gets sad when his book gets wet. Flop helps him to understand that even though the book is wet, the story isnt.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has a great time choosing the perfect present for Sula in Padgets shop. Its a wand and is sparkly and flashy and spinny and Bing knows that she will love it. Bing is thrilled until it is time to hand the present over.

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Its the Annual Pontypandy Bread Baking Competition and Hannah is determined to win by baking bread on an open fire, but her competitive streak ends up causing a wildfire. Meanwhile Miss Pawdry sabotages Elvis’s cleaning efforts.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Big Owl gets dirty and Kipper decides to give him a bath. Tiger’s hat falls in the mud and they decide to give it a bath too. Things get totally out of hand and they wash blankets, all the other toys and finally themselves.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are having fun discovering various animals’ houses. When they realize butterflies don’t have a house, they decide to build a beautiful "Butterfly Hotel!" programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When Nina asks T’choupi to accompany her to the forest for a fitness session, our little hero gets very excited… until they reach the location and there’s no fitness trail in sight! Nina laughs: that’s the funnest part about it - they’ll use the tree trunks, boulders and branches to make their own parcourse! T’choupi drags his heels as he follows Nina through the "trail." Then, when he trips and falls, he wants to call it quits… But what if he were to invent his very own fitness trail in the forest? Wouldn’t that be fun…?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia wonders why her mom store the gifts she offered her in the closet while Sams mom displays his on the chimney piece of their living room. Don’t she like the present her daughter gave her?

programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are watching a detective series on television before going to bed and they are fascinated by Sherlocks knack for solving enigmas. So when Poet cannot find his cuddly bear the next morning he decides to conduct an investigation. The kids search the entire apartment for evidence, with their magnifying glass, but in vain. They go to the bakery, then to the park and ask passersby for their help but still not a trace of the bear. It is finally Toto and his great sense of smell that will lead them to the cuddly toy, which was simply bundled up in Poets blanket.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are thrilled: Eliott is coming over to babysit them tonight and they want him to tell them a scary story. But as the story goes along the kids are more and more frightened and prefer going to bed without hearing the end. How can they avoid nightmares? How about setting a net around their beds, using a magic cuddly bear or invoking a protective fairy? Suddenly they hear a loud noise in the apartment! Phew, it is only mom. The Triplets are really glad she is home.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou is having a fun day playing with his Marbles,when Grandpa arrives with his old Trainset. Grandpa likes toplay slow and steady - but Caillou and Daddy have other ideas!

programme.desc: Caillou and Rosie go to a farm to select a new pet - aBunny! But when they take the rabbit home, Caillou is a bit tooloud and excitable, meaning the rabbit becomes more comfortablewith Rosie.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Daisy the railcar can carry passengers without having to pull any coaches. So, when Thomas is sent to work in the quarry for a spell and Daisy takes on his usual responsibilities, Annie and Clarabel are left behind. Daisy takes every opportunity to remind Annie and Clarabel that, as long as she is working Thomas’s branch line, they are not needed. But, when Daisy becomes popular with her passengers, she has to pull some passenger coaches after all! Annie and Clarabel get their own back by tricking Daisy into thinking she is need of repair. But two wrongs don’t make a right and Annie and Clarabel only end up being left behind in a siding… and then pulled along by dirty old Diesel! *Cough! Cough!*

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Wilsons long time trusted wagon is falling apart! Will Wilson roll with his long trusted wagon until the wheels fall off, or can his chuggtastic friends convince him to retire wag-a-lagon before its too late?

programme.desc: Hatty helps Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave make toy sailing boats and race them down the river. Discovering which things float and what makes a great sail makes it an exciting race to the finish!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Nina and Dad have fun imitating birdsongs and are very good at it. Tchoupi, however, is totally unable to join in: singing like a bird isn’t his forte! Frustrated, he suggests they play hide And seek in the forest instead. Nina’s fine with it… as long as they do a "special kind of hide And seek," using birdsongs to find each other! T’choupi opts for the simplest song of all: a cuckoo, with its characteristic "kookoo" greeting: Kookoo, kookoo!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari is skating her way through the park in an urgent hurry to find a bathroom. She finally spots a public toilet and dashes in. After she finished her business, she encounter a green peacock with its tail feathers open, admiring itself in the mirror. The creature is blocking the way out of the toilet. Back in the garden. Leo and Katie are playing with a large hand mirror where Leo draws on it to make the the person seeing themselves to have bunny whiskers. They play around with Hero, their dog. Then Leo receives a call from Zari, informing of her being trapped by the green peacock. After learning more information on the animal back in their treehouse, the Junior Rangers agree in helping Zari escapes there by travelling to save her. Once they arrive, Leo has an idea of using the large hand mirror to bait the peacock out of the public toilet. His plan work, but now the peacock is attempting to chases him over. Leo evades the animals pounce when Ranger Rocky grab him above to saves him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a hot summer day, Berry, Dolly, Bubble and Balthazar put on their swimsuits, looked for their buckets, shovels and started to build the loveliest sand castle on the Sand Island.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a sunny autumn day, Berry and Dolly went into to forest to pick blueberries. Flutter, the butterfly girl, and Eddy, the potato beetle joined them as well. When Eddy saw the fruitful bushes can’t help but pick all the best fruits before the others. What’s left to do?

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: It’s December, and it’s gingerbread time! Berry and Dolly love making them. Berry’s house filled with the wonderful smell of the biscuits what the magpie immediately noticed from above. Grabbed the bowl and flew away with it. Oh my!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a summer afternoon after a heavy storm Leapy, the grasshopper found an injured stranger, He immediately called for help. Berry and Dolly arrived in no time as always.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly are planting sunflowers on a spring day. They take care of the flowers carefully as they emerge from the ground and grow tall. The two friends are very happy. Unfortunately the joy does not last long; someone damaged the flowers.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula have a penny each for the Surprise Machine in Padget’s shop. Sula gets the silver rhino she wanted so Bing is convinced he will get the toy he wants too. When the Surprise Machine delivers his capsule Bing is upset to discover the alien he has set his heart on is not inside.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to get dizzy on the roundybout so Pando pushes him. Its not long before Bing realises that some dizzy is fun but too much dizzy is not fun at all.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing builds a house out of sofa cushions and Coco decides its perfect for a game of Big Bad Wolf. Bing enjoys being wolfie until hes not allowed into the house he built.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s a hot day and Bing and Flop buy an ice lolly from Gilly the ice cream lady. Before they can eat them a frog hops into Bing’s paddling pool and they go to the rescue. By the time they return to the ice lollies all that’s left are the sticks and a plate of lolly goo.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets very enthusiastic when he and Sula paint a mural and his painting starts to drop all over Sulas. Sula is upset until she realises that the painting isnt spoiled, its just different.

programme.title: Bing Bunny - Shorts and characters
programme.desc: Get to know our little pets better through charming stories featuring the characters from the popular Bing series.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: At the beach, Simon discovers a crab sitting in a pool of water between the rocks. But a little girl, Maelle, is already there and she declares that the pool of water is hers! Simon doesn’t agree one little bit! In order to see who gets to “own” the pool of water, Simon offers a challenge: see who can catch a crab first! Simon loses this particular challenge, but he wins the next one, which consists in collecting the most winkles. One last challenge will decide the definitive winner: the first one to reach the water wins the whole beach!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: The parents leave for an adventure and the children decide to have some big adventures too. For Scoutbadger and Rosie this means going far from the burrow while for Woodsy it means building some wings so that he can fly. But perhaps these big dreams are just a little too big ?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The first snowfall of the Winter blankets the entire meadow, and Little Nutbrown Hare is confused because he can no longer see the bush, the log or his seedpod ball under all the snow! Will Little Nutbrown Hare be able to find his way around the meadow now that all his familiar places are covered under a blanket of fresh white snow?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a snowy Winter’s morning Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are amazed at the intricate patterns they find in the snowflakes, each one different from the others. The friends try to take one to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but they always melt before he sees them. Will they find a way to stop the lovely flakes from melting?

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Its Easter Monday, and the sprinklers are coming to visit Annalee. Boribon also starts painting eggs, but he doesnt succeed at first… or does he?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia were supposed to attend a cartoon screening at the theater, but Sam has to babysit the triplets. Is there a way to keep an eye on them and still go to watch the movie?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Today, the Triplets feel like playing pirates and Nini would love to play along. Oh no! She’s too young to play pirates with us ! However, Nini has a solid argument: a treasure! Quick, the Triplets and Nini run to the park to protect and bury it. But when Mrs Bun cannot find her jewelry, all eyes turn to Nini who confesses she put them in her treasure box. Good thing the kids drew a map leading to the treasure. Now all they have to do is: Decipher it!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Mom has invited friends over for dinner tonight. The Triplets have to finish eating before they arrive: it is a dinner for "grownups only"! Too bad, they will not be able to taste the delicious meal Mom has prepared. But Mom tells them that the dinner would be extremely boring for them, so no need to be disappointed. Ding Dong! The doorbell rings! « Sorry, the dinner is not tonight! », Girl tells the guests. That way Mom won’t have to spend a boring evening with them either.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Brewster is learning to use the mega-­‐chug crane, but his training time is cut short when they are called away to fix some damage in a mine tunnel. As they cross the old rickety bridge it collapses, leaving Zack stranded on the other side. How will they ever reach him? Brewster has an idea. The chuggers help him transport the mega-­‐chug crane up the steep mountain. It’s a tough challenge and they nearly don’t manage it, but Brewster is determined. He uses all his crane skills to lift Zack safely out of the high tunnel. Zack could not be prouder of his trainee.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: A "pesky" mole causes trouble for Moose when the mole decides that Moose’s Wild Man Golf course is the perfect place to build a few molehills. Meanwhile the firefighters learn the Breathing Apparatus Boogie!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Its the Annual Pontypandy Bread Baking Competition and Hannah is determined to win by baking bread on an open fire, but her competitive streak ends up causing a wildfire. Meanwhile Miss Pawdry sabotages Elvis’s cleaning efforts.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper, Tiger and Pig decide to have a race. The prize is one of Pig’s chocolate cakes. Tiger goes on his tricycle and ends up in the duck pond but Kipper keeps running. Arnold gets a lift with Jake on his scooter. Guess who gets the chocolate cake?

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Pig leaves Arnold with Kipper and wobbles off on his bicycle. Kipper lends Arnold his first bike and, with the help of stabilisers, they have a wonderful ride round Big Hill. Pig can’t believe its Arnold hurtling towards him on his return – a better bike rider than Pig will ever be.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: When Caillou gets the giggles at school, his silliness disrupts the rest of the class. In a rodeo fantasy, an announcer’s (Leo) silly antics are distracting to Buck Buckaroo (Caillou), and Caillou learns that being silly is great, but sometimes you have to shake your sillies out for your friends.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: When Daddy has to stop playing with Caillou and Leo to run an errand, the boys try to stop Daddy from leaving. Then in a farmer fantasy where a farmer and his farm hand (Caillou and Leo) are bombarded by clingy sheep, Caillou and Leo learn that they can have fun while they wait for Daddy to return.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Oliver is always telling his brake van Toad about his adventures and Toad longs to have an adventure of his own. So when the chance comes to work with James, Toad is very excited. But James doesn’t like pulling trucks and goes too fast and then, when a coupling snaps, Toad gets a bigger adventure than he bargained for.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In this adventure, Kyle discovers a vibrant Peacock Spider in the Southern Australian Forest, fascinated by its cute and colorful appearance. Curiosity piqued, he calls the Junior Rangers, interrupting their game of musical statues. Concerned about the spiders potential venom, they consult their computer for information, learning about the spiders unique features and the dance it uses for courtship. Suddenly, a female brown spider interrupts the males dance and gets aggressive to which Leo, Katie and Hero fly off to Kyle to assist him. As they arrive, the brown spider continues to chase the colorful spider which leads to chaos as the spider jumps around, onto everyone, especially Kyle. The spider eventually seeks refuge on Kyle’s hat. They stumble upon Ranger Rocky, who calls Ranger Joey to give them insights on the spiders mating dance. With newfound understanding, they assist the male spider with its dance by dancing with it together and dressing up Kyle in colorful leaves to get its attention. With everyone dancing, including Hero, the male spider finally dances again and successfully impresses the female as they crawl away together. Back at the Treehouse, Leo, Katie, and Hero continue their game of musical chairs.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the wetlands of China, Kais drone, the Kaimera-1000, captures stunning footage of Red-Crowned Cranes before abruptly crashing into a crane’s nest. Faced with the challenge of retrieving the drone without disturbing the nesting crane, Leo, Katie, and Hero embark on a mission. They go on a search to find the drone via air but when they do find it, a crane sits on its nest - with the drone in it! They attempt to distract the crane using recorded calls of the crane but fail until a curious crane chick responds. Hero befriends the chick, triggering a joyful dance among the cranes. Hero howls, followed by the chick peeping, which causes the nesting crane to come and check on its baby. This allows Kai to recover his drone discreetly from the nest. Back at the treehouse, Leo questions why Hero is still howling and declares it a mystery but then his question is answered when a pair of cranes flies by.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: The Train Station in Pencaster is getting a brand new stained glass window but, um, the locals think that the new modern art window isnt all that great.. Pats job is to deliver it but when it gets a dangerous crack in it during the journey Ajay says he cant accept the delivery. Its a Special Delivery: Mission Not Accomplished! Oh dear! Pat knows exactly who to ask for help and the children of Greendale School find their gorgeious mosaic picture of Greendale comes in very handy.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Mrs Goggins has organised a fun sculpture trail, and lots of people have made sculptures.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunnys friends gather for a cake party.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is "Its a Bing thing!" which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are both tired but insist on one last game of Hide and Seek before bed. Pando finds a great hiding place under the covers of Bing’s bed but by the time Bing finds him he’s fast asleep. Bing is tired too and gets upset when he thinks there’s nowhere left for him to sleep, but Flop and Padget find a way.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula help Amma to get lunch ready. Bing watches yummy peas and delicious carrots go into the pot, but when lunch is served theyre all mixed up together and Bing doesnt like it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing falls in love with a lost dog he and Flop find in the park and decides he wants to keep her. When the owner turns up Bing is very upset when it comes to saying goodbye to his new friend.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and the gang are eagerly making preparations for the following day’s Big City Autumn Festival. There is a lot of excitement and activity in the air and once the preparations have been made everyone retires for the night in eager anticipation of the next day. The following morning, however, they wake up to find it has snowed overnight, making plans for a Big City Autumn Festival seem ruined. But ever the optimist, Oswald shows everyone that they can have an even better time in the snow.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Weenie catch a firefly in Big City Park and get their chance to make a wish. But making a wish is a lot harder than they think – after all, they love everything they already have. After a whole day and night of not being able to make up their minds, Oswald and Weenie return to the Park only to find that all of the other fireflies have disappeared! Only then does Oswald realise what the wish should be.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is looking after Curtis’s garage while Leo takes him out for a birthday meal at Chef Tattie’s. However, the meal is a ruse, arranged so that Bob and his gang can secretly give Curtis’ workshop a makeover. Scoop is excited to be at the garage; he claims to have a great knowledge of mechanics. The build is all on schedule until Bob is forced to attend to Mr Bentley who keeps him busy because he’s very fussy about how much air he has in Philip’s tyres. At the restaurant Curtis is keen to get back to the garage as he is nervous about leaving it in somebody else’s hands. When Bob rings Leo and asks him to play for time Leo orders more and more food for himself to eat. At the, now busy, garage Scoop decides to take a look at what’s troubling Betsy, using the new vehicle inspection lift.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are building Spring City’s new Ice Rink when the Rockets arrive and plead with him to finish it as soon as possible. They explain that the rink they were going to be playing on that evening is out of action and they have no-where to play! Bob tells them he’ll do his best and the building begins. Muck is fascinated by the idea of Ice Hockey and when Bob and Wendy set off to get the clear plastic panels to fit in the barrier surrounds, Muck decides to have a little go himself. Despite Leo’s protestations, all the machines are soon skidding about on the ice causing mayhem! When Bob and Wendy arrive back, they are alarmed to see all the barriers knocked down! Muck says sorry but Bob knows that the Rockets will be back very soon and they need to work fast.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Autumn day Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse convince Little Grey Squirrel to leave his pile of spotted acorns unattended, so they can all play with the crunchy leaves. While they’re gone Little Redwood Fox discovers the yummy acorns and takes them home. Once she finds out they actually belong Little Grey Squirrel, she has to decide whether to give them back or keep them.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The first snowfall of the Winter blankets the entire meadow, and Little Nutbrown Hare is confused because he can no longer see the bush, the log or his seedpod ball under all the snow! Will Little Nutbrown Hare be able to find his way around the meadow now that all his familiar places are covered under a blanket of fresh white snow?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a snowy Winter’s morning Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are amazed at the intricate patterns they find in the snowflakes, each one different from the others. The friends try to take one to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but they always melt before he sees them. Will they find a way to stop the lovely flakes from melting?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: It’s dressing up time and Timmy plays Doctor! Poor Teddy is sick, can you help Timmy put some plasters on Teddy to make him better?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids find some numbered papers blowing around the park. After investigating several possibilities of where they could be from, they finally figure out they were once fastened to trees in the park as part of a self-guided tour to celebrate Arbor Day. / When all the milk in Huckle’s Dad’s store turns out to be sour, Huckle, Sally and Lowly set out to find out why.

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Its the day of Mayor Okis Ice-skate Skate-tacular. Only there is too much ice and its stopping everyone from getting to the show! Messy must find away to metl the ice and save the show.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy is in the kitchen making a jam sandwich. He jumps to grab the sandwich from the side but accidentally loses his grip - whoops! Poor Messy, his sandwich is all over the floor! “But why do things always fall down and not up?” he asks and transports himself to Okido to find out. In Okido, Messy joins Zoe and Felix in the garden, who are stargazing at the night sky. They spot a shooting star. As it zips across the sky it starts to get bigger in size. Now it’s travelling towards them! “Duck”, shouts Messy, as it lands right in front of them.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: The twins birthday is approaching. Sour says she does not wish to share the birthday with Sweet. Sweet is sad that her sister feels that way but respects her wish. Sour initially enjoys having a birthday of her own and the activities the Berry girls plan for her, but gradually feels lonely without her sister, and regrets what she said earlier.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is disappointed to find that he is not able to join in with any of the activities his family are taking part in at home.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry is told to tidy his room he simply transfers all the mess into Dino-world, where he is told there is a no tidying up rule.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo discovers a reef manta ray pup in the garden. The Junior Rangers set sail to find the manta ray a home in the ocean, but what happens when Ranger Rocky gets stuck in a sea jelly bloom?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas is working on the Indian Railway and Charubala rewards him for always being early by giving him a very important job - delivering some precious silk to a famous fashion designer. But when Thomas sees swimming elephants on his journey, he gets so excited that he misses his turning and delivers the silk to the wrong station without realizing. Instead of listening to Ashimas advice and telling Charubala, Thomas attempts to sort out his mistake alone. He ends up getting himself into even more trouble by picking up the wrong cars/trucks, not listening to Noor Jehans warnings and continuing to not tell Charubala about the big mess he has caused. Finally he owns up to his mistakes and everyone helps him put things right!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas thinks that Raul the Brazilian tank engine is fun because he turns every boring task into a game.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Some sheeps escaped from Mr. Guellecs field. The farmer is torn as he cant watch the herd and fix the broken fence which allows the sheep to run away at the same time.Its a perfect mission for Grisu who will learn to be a shepherd, with Stellas help. But the task isnt a piece of cake since the sheep dont want to listen to him at all. They rush away throughout the streets of Dragontown, causing troubles. Grisu and Stella have to discover how to steer a herd, especially a stubborn black sheep. Not an easy mission but as ever, a fire fighter never gives up!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: The Dragon Stone, a beautiful and rare stone that Grisus ancestors found centuries ago breaks accidently. It was supposed to be the main stone of an exhibition that Professor Smeraldo has set up. To avoid cancelling the exhibition, Grisu, Fume and Stella go to explore a cave where they might find another legendary Dragon Stone. But the expedition turns into an adventure when they realize that only the two kids are able to go through the very small entrance of the cave. The quest quickly appears to be a big task for such young kids, even if one of them is a dragon. But thanks to their tenacity (fire-fighters never give up!), Grisu and Stella will be able to find the legendary stone and to find their way back. The exhibition will be saved!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s Spring blossom season and the pretty pink blossoms that come floating down the stream remind Big Nutbrown Hare of a magnificent cherry tree from his youth. He sets off cross- country to find it, with Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, but the journey is longer and harder than he remembered. Will the blossoms floating downstream give them a clue as to a shorter way home?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends go on a hunt for treasure in the meadow and collect all kinds of unique gems like flowers, feathers, apples and egg-shells. But there’s a hole in Little Nutbrown Hare’s leaf-bag and he loses the precious collection along the way. Luckily, Big Nutbrown Hare is not far behind to collect the lost treasure as well as follow its trail to find his son.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Woodsy has had enough of Berry telling the parents when he does something he shouldnt. Following Loudo’s advice, he devises a good way to stop this tale-telling. Now, when Berry tells tales about him, no one will believe her… But is this really a good idea ?

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: JJ and Mila are training for a snowboarding stunt show to be performed at the opening of the Winter in Spring Festival - a celebration of winter in Spring City. Bob and the team will be building a triple chairlift to transport passengers to the top of Observatory Hill. But Bob isn’t keen on the cold weather - he’d much prefer to be building sandcastles on the beach! During a work break, Skye offers Bob a snowboarding lesson - and he’s terrible! Meanwhile, Scoop is determined to have a slide down the snowy hill - but Wendy warns him that without snow chains, he’ll have no control. Scoop can’t resist... and ends up sliding all over the slope and crashing into a support beam, causing the chairlift cable to jump off the wheel tracks.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and his crew are finishing off the new penguin pool at Spring City Zoo. It’s almost complete when Lofty accidentally drops a large rock, which smashes the observation window. It’s urgent that they fix it quickly because the penguins will be arriving any moment. Meanwhile Mayor Madison and Mr. Bentley are entertaining a special visitor, the grouchy Mayor Snipe from Riverdale. They take him on a tour of the city, but he isn’t impressed with the castle, the sports stadium or the revolving restaurant.Back at the zoo the penguins have arrived, but the pool isn’t ready for them yet. Leo has been busy working on a new pond and water feature at The Town Hall, and Lofty suggests the penguins can stay there until their new home is ready.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Trying to figure out what a strange piece of metal with a number 10 on it is, Huckle and his pals take it to Blacksmith Bear who helps them discover strange writing on it. Figuring it must be a foreign language, they take it to Ms Honey and, with her help, determine the piece of metal is a lost tap from Hilda’s French tap dance shoes./Huckle and pals set out to find the whistle blower who is causing a traffic jam.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers head to the ocean to find a home for a young scalloped hammerhead shark. Unfortunately, the adventure takes a wet turn when the hammerhead shark gets caught in a shrimp net.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo comes across an eastern spotted skunk while playing a game of mini-golf in the garden. The Junior Rangers pop by the prairie to find a suitable home for the skunk, but an unfriendly coyote could put a dent in their plans.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: The doctor has come to give Simon and his little brother their yearly vaccination. Seeing that the boys are scared, the doctor suggests that Simon be his assistant! Simon takes his new role very, very seriously, even though the doctor himself does some pretty silly stuff. The two of them work so well together that Gaspard relaxes completely and the doctor is able to give him his vaccination shot without the little rabbit even noticing. Same for Simon who braves it out like a champ. Ha, doesn’t even hurt!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, catches a cold on a gloomy, rainy day. Doctor Owl examines her and advises her to rest a lot in bed. Her friends visit often to take care of her, and Flutter always asks them to read from her new book. Soon, everyone knows the story, which tells of a ball held in a splendid castle. One day, Balthazar makes Flutter sad by saying that the princess story is just a fairy tale. Flutter turns away, disappointed, and falls asleep. Balthazar meets Doctor Owl, who notices that something is bothering him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Mama Owls chicks are born, and soon they are strong enough for Berry and Dolly to visit them. Doctor Owl asks for their help while he works. The owl babies are very lively, and Berry and Dolly play with them enthusiastically and patiently. At lunchtime, Mama Owl is running out of patience, but eventually, they manage to feed the chicks. After finishing lunch and resting a little, the little ones regain their energy. They happily jump around Mama Owl, who feels it is time that the chicks learn to fly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, plays beautifully on his violin for the forest inhabitants, but one day, no one listens to his new piece. First, he looks for Berry, Balthazar, and Stanley, but they are busy. He goes to Dolly, but she doesn’t have time either. Very discouraged, he decides to leave the forest. However, he meets the Magpie, who welcomes him and cheers him up. Meanwhile, the others begin to search for Alfonso. When they find him, they apologize and invite him to play his new piece at the playground opening.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One autumn day, Reggie Squirrel is visited by his old friend, Otto Badger, who brings a frisbee as a gift. They happily play with it, and when they head home, the frisbee falls at the base of a tree. Later, Berry and his friends find it and play with it, but Balthazar throws it so far that the frisbee vanishes. Reggie Squirrel asks them about it later, but Balthazar denies having seen it. Dolly and Flutter find the frisbee and bring it back to Reggie. Berry, feeling ashamed, admits that they accidentally threw the frisbee and couldnt find it. In the end, they all play happily with it until dark, carefully making sure not to throw it too far.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Leapy, the grasshopper girl, gets paint on her hair while painting her house in the spring. She can’t wash it off, so Zephyr, the dragonfly, offers to cut her hair. Leapy is very sad when she sees herself in the mirror; she doesn’t like her new hairstyle. At Zephyrs suggestion, they show the others, but only Dolly notices the change and compliments her. Later, they hold a hairstyle day, where everyone creates special hairstyles for themselves. Leapy happily finishes painting her house and invites her friends to a spring feast.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Stanleys birthday is approaching, and he becomes very curious and can’t wait to find out what gift he will receive from Dolly. He peeks into the ladybird girls drawer. The next day, he tells Balthazar that he knows what his gift will be. On his birthday, the friends gather and wish Stanley a happy birthday. Flutter presents the cake, they sing, and then Stanley blows out the candles and cuts the cake. Stanley receives many nice gifts, including a bowling set from Dolly. Stanley admits that he peeked into the ladybird girls drawer because he was curious about his gift.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Shaun invites his friends to Sand Island during the summer heatwave. Christopher and Chloe, the two canaries, ferry the friends over. Bubble, Balthazar, Dolly, Stanley, Berry, Flutter, and Shaun build sand houses. Balthazar accidentally knocks down Bubble the flower beetles house. Suddenly, a summer shower begins and washes away all the sand houses. They stand sadly around their ruined creations and decide to build a large drip sandcastle together. Side by side, they build drip towers, construct castle walls, and decorate the tops with sand balls. The day passes joyfully, and by the evening, when the canaries come to pick them up, magnificent drip towers stand tall on the island.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunnys friends gather for a cake party.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is "Its a Bing thing!" which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are both tired but insist on one last game of Hide and Seek before bed. Pando finds a great hiding place under the covers of Bing’s bed but by the time Bing finds him he’s fast asleep. Bing is tired too and gets upset when he thinks there’s nowhere left for him to sleep, but Flop and Padget find a way.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula help Amma to get lunch ready. Bing watches yummy peas and delicious carrots go into the pot, but when lunch is served theyre all mixed up together and Bing doesnt like it.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is a clever and intelligent mouse who lives in a tiny house at the base of the church wall with her pet Snaily and her best friends.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda finds a bottle containing a treasure map in the stream. She excitedly shows Rupert her discovery and the two go on a treasure hunt. They turn Wild Rose Lane on its head, but theres no treasure to be found. After hours of searching in vain, the pair recover with a tasty picnic in Tildas garde, where Tilda finally decodes the complicated map.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tildas Great Great Aunt Emily is visiting Wild Rose Lane. Rupert suggests they have a competition to decide which of the two mice bakes the better cheesecake. While Emily sets to work in Ruperts kitchen, Tilda discovers an old recipe from her ancestor Eusebia which sounds better than her own.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Days On a hot Summer’s day Big Nutbrown Hare wants the young ones to have some relaxing time by the river. Like most young kids they have trouble staying quiet and still. When they do finally manage some quiet time, they experience the variety of life that the river has to offer, including some rare birds and a family of terrapins.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare wakes up to a colourful sprig of holly in the snow outside the hollow log. It’s surprise gift from Little Spotty Deer, who has returned to the meadow. This gives Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse the idea to spread the joy and surprise all their other friends with a holly sprig too, so the three of them make a game of it. Theme: Spreading fun and joy.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Day It is the shortest day of the year so the sun doesnt rise until very late and is going to set very early. To Little Nutbrown Hare everything feels mixed up and theres no time to do all the things he wants to do. That’s until he and Little Field Mouse name it Topsy-Flopsy Day and decide to make a fun and funny day of it!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn his Training Badge, Wilson must teach Hoot and Toot how to use the paint car. Unfortunately, he’s so busy demonstrating how good he is at painting, he doesn’t teach them anything. He realises his mistake when time is nearly up – he should have been showing them instead of showing off! Wilson sadly goes through a list of all the things he should have taught them. Hoot and Toot listen closely and surprise Wilson by passing their test. Wilson earns his badge after all!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Jayden is about to take a bite of his peanut butter sandwich before things take an unexpected turn when a crafty raccoon snatches his comms device. Simultaneously, Leo and Katie engage in a decluttering activity in the garden, pondering which possessions to keep or give away. They receive a call from Jayden but instead of seeing Jayden on the screen, it’s the raccoon on the run! Confused, this prompts the Junior Rangers swift response. They arrive and meet with a tired and lost Jayden who shows them the direction the raccoon went. This leads them near a road where the raccoon runs in the middle of it, which raises the rangers’ concerns about relocating the raccoon. They meet up with Ranger Rocky who calls Ranger Joey to provide insights into raccoon behavior and habits. Jaydens ingenious use of a peanut butter and jelly sandwich to bait the raccoon into giving back the comms device works but Ranger Rocky intervenes and reminds them not to feed wildlife but the raccoon scurries off. The day concludes with a successful mission and Leo, Katie and Hero continue with sorting their stuff and Hero lets go of his unused toy.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah, navigating the scorching Thar Desert, finds Hardwickes Spiny-Tailed Lizards seemingly braving the intense heat. Concerned for their well-being, she contacts Leo and Katie who are in the garden about to commence in a water gun chase but are interrupted when Hero steals the water gun. Upon consulting the computer, they learn that the lizards need sunlight to regulate their body temperature. During the call, a falcon appears and scares the lizards back into their burrows! Leo, Katie and Hero fly to the desert to help the lizards find a way to stay in the sun without being harmed by the falcon. Attempting to aid them, they construct a tent, only for it to crash to their disappointment. They meet with Ranger Rocky who seeks advice from Ranger Joey, they discover the importance of sunlight for these cold-blooded creatures. A lizard approaches the rangers, trusting them enough to be around them when suddenly the falcon swoops in towards it! Hero intervenes to protect the lizard from the falcon and it flies off. With Ranger Rockys assistance, they come up with a new plan to keep the falcon away instead of protecting the lizards. With CDs hung on a tree, it reflects light which scares the falcon. The lizards can now safely bask in the sun, marking the success of the mission. In the Treehouse, a water gun fight ensues between Leo and Katie.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are planning to go on a picnic with Nina’s donkey Coquelicot but the animal is stubbornly refusing to leave its enclosure! So the two friends decide to pamper it to get it to loosen up, hoping it will then be more inclined to move! But it’s no good: the nervous donkey simply refuses to budge an inch!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: This morning, T’choupi notices that the pretty drawing Lalou sent him through the mail has been chewed! But who’s the culprit?! Nina argues that none of her animals could have done it but T’choupi is certain it’s one of the pets at Nina’s house. And he’s determined to find out which one! He gets a surprise when he finds out that the little nibbler is not a usual suspect!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi, Nina and Mom are busy sowing seeds in the small vegetable garden. But a bird keeps coming along and pecking them up as soon as they’ve been sown! So T’choupi and Nina decide to build a scarecrow to protect the seedbeds. They go about it in secret (although with Dad’s help) to give Mom a nice surprise. However, they get a disappointment when they realize their scarecrow isn’t scary at all!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia is angry with Sam who stepped on her tail. Sam hurt her and she lost her balance. Julia doesnt want to talk to him anymore! As best he can, Sam tries to make up with his friend.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Miss Gossip wants to write an article about Julia, as a recent inhabitant. The journalist needs informations about her island, from a book that belong to Julias mother, so not to be loosed...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas and Edward decide to teach Gordon a lesson after he refuses to thank Edward for rescuing him from Gordon Hill, despite previously berating the smaller engine for being old and unreliable.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Annie and Clarabel are always complaining to Thomas about going too fast. Thomas likes to tease them, by going too fast or too slow (so Annie and Clarabel will ask him to go faster again). But when Annie and Clarabel find themselves coupled to Caitlin by mistake, they get a taste of what going fast is really like, and poor Thomas gets frightened that they might be taken to the mainland forever.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou is at a pottery studio with Mommy and he wants tomake his dad the best present ever for Fathers Day. Except pottery isa lot harder than it seems! Wow. programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures

Not far away they find a big chocolate-covered key./When Busytown residents are baffled by mysterious door knocking, Huckle and gang discover who it is.

programme.title: Fireman Sam

programme.title: Doodleboo

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is disappointed when a trail of ants disappears with the delicious Spring berries he’s found. And when he sees how clever the ants are, he soon wants to be like them.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The Summer meadow is home to a many amazing treasures of nature. Meanwhile, Big Nutbrown Hare has discovered the biggest blue treasure of them all. What could it be?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

Big Nutbrown Hare sends Little Nutbrown Hare off to invite his friends for breakfast so he can rest a little longer. Along the way Little Nutbrown Hare discovers how wonderful and different all his friends homes are. Will Little Nutbrown Hare still love his own home as much as he did?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are in the park playing at being giants and splashing in puddles with their big welly boots. programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco shows Bing how to do really good Big Boos and together they make Flop jump. When Bing tries out his new tricks on Charlie he finds out the power of Boo has to be scaled down for babies.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

programme.desc: On a summer afternoon after a heavy storm Leapy, the grasshopper found an injured stranger, He immediately called for help. Berry and Dolly arrived in no time as always.

programme.desc: While looking for a lost toy under a bunch of crates, Nina and T’choupi discover some very strange hairs belonging to some unidentified animal … In a mystery, the two friends head off to inspect all the animals of the hamlet in an attempt to track down the owner of the strange fur... programme.title: Charley Loves Nature

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed

programme.desc: When her little girl says she wants to become a doctor, mom tells her that it takes a lot of work. Surely enough, Girl decides to start training right away, with her first aid kit. programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Snow comes early to the Island of Sodor – and it is heavier than usual! Donald and Douglas are coupled back-to-back with a van between their tenders and snowploughs on their fronts. programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: This lunchtime, T’choupi refuses to eat the fish Dad has cooked, supposedly because it doesn’t look tasty. But Mom insists: T’choupi can’t say he doesn’t like it if he hasn’t even tried it! So, when his parents aren’t looking, T’choupi slips his piece of fish to Ciboulette the cat, who just happens to be passing by at that moment. There we are – no-one’s any the wiser, mumbles T’choupi with a sigh of relief. But when, a short time later, he notices poor little Ciboulette has a strange cough, he gets worried: did the fish he gave her to eat give her a stomach ache??!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyle arrives at the beach on his ATV only to be disappointed by the sight of scattered trash. Reluctantly, he cleans up the mess while venting his frustration at the unknown culprit. As he heads back to his ATV, he encounters a curious raccoon but fails to get close to it as it scampers away at the sound of the trash bag. Curiosity gets the better of Kyle, leading him to investigate underneath his ATV. To his surprise, he discovers a partially buried nest of eggs. Meanwhile, in the garden, Leo and Katie prepare a bath for their beloved dog Hero. Much to their astonishment, Hero returns with a duckling in tow, leaving everyone perplexed. The duckling jumps into the bath, enjoying itself, and Hero finds himself torn between joining in or not. Amidst the confusion, Leo receives a call from Kyle, who informs him about the raccoon that laid the eggs. Skeptical at first, the Junior Rangers decide to gather more information using Katies computer. Convinced of the situations authenticity, they agree to meet up with Kyle to help him move his stuck ATV without disturbing the eggs. They strategize and come up with a plan to lift the ATV using it like a helicopter. Their efforts pay off, but as the eggs start to hatch, they notice the baby turtles heading in the wrong direction away from the ocean. Kyle attempts to intervene but is stopped by the arrival of Ranger Rocky, who emerges from the sea.
